FrX9Tv2tB-uLL1qu6_ojsg.text: Honest burger is definitelly top! Homemade lemonade and rosemary fries are always a good choice.

Szav32ShGKcI7QlSYi_2rg.text: Juicy burgers, friendly staff in a nice setting. Sit downstairs and watch you're burgers cooking!

fPvxkguFbXBnZYeK6Jxv7Q.text: Probably the best burger and fries I ever had and I'm American.  The Fries were awesome with the rosemary and perfectly crispy.  Would go back just to have more fries.  The Burger was perfectly cooked to my specification (medium rare) and i had the Honest Burger with bacon, chedder, pickled cucumbers and tomato relish.  Freaking delicious.  Service was awesome, my waiter was very friendly and cool.  Definitely returning.

6wMInxz0ZzPlOp-dxWKL1A.text: I'm definitely a fan of Honest Burger. I convinced a friend at work to hop on a bus to King's Cross to give this branch a try. (Although honestly, it didn't take much convincing.) It's a great location, and with seating both upstairs and down, it's a much larger location than the Soho location I've been to in the past. So that's a bonus.I ordered the special. This month it was the Ribman Special. I always order the special to be fair. I once ordered the Honest Burger and while it was nice, it was lacking something. But the special burgers are usually where it's at (and with their crazy beer burger in March, I'll be going back at least once). The Ribman Special apparently has a hot sauce on it. Quite hot as the waiter felt the need to tell me. I was excited. I love hot food. I'm a spice addict. So I was a bit disappointed when my burger came out with no hot sauce. To be honest, I'm not convinced it wasn't just an Honest Burger. But I asked for the hot sauce to be brought on the side and slathered it on. Heavenly. And I had a ton of it, so I made a nice dipping sauce of Christ on a Bike hot sauce and mayo for the rest of my chips. My dining companion also got the Chipotle mayo on the side. Get that too. It's delish. Honestly, everything is delish.Oh, and apparently they do onion rings now. And not just any onion rings. Smoked onion rings. And they're amazing. And in my honest opinion, they are the best rings I've had in London. They are incredibly crisp, light and delicious. And not at all greasy. I couldn't believe how good they were.So a huge honest thumbs up to this branch of Honest Burger. It's probably the easiest for me to get to at work (a 10 minute bus ride tops, or an even shorter Tube ride as long as people don't mind paying for a Zone 1 Tube ride), and on the weekends, the closest to home. So I'll be back. I will. And the special burgers will be mine. And the rings. And hopefully they do a wicked Bloody Mary like the Soho branch.

EYmF8JS4UPAs4SfTNySJ6w.text: Great seating layout and decor. They have really really good burgers and yummy sides like onion rings and "fries" or "Chips" depending on where you are from. Service was great and fast.

Lt0-w6qN6Z0bVroIjqKObg.text: Passed by this place many times and never stopped to try it. I must have been mad!  Their burgers are spectacular! Great quality ingredients, perfect mix of spices make these a flavor fest. The fries are also very tasty as are the onion rings (the best I've ever had).

aSUOut03o8DiIXJ2iPaa2Q.text: Great burgers and rosemary fries. Veggie burger is a good option for the non-meat eaters (and cheap!)

zletVtSn5B4mgLuHpYpgiA.text: Still the best burger in town (and that's a French palate speaking).

FbDSEkvERR5YLD6X-Zyy6A.text: The chips were rather hard and tasteless, but the honest burger was amazingly moist and delicious. My husband thought the meat itself lacked in flavour, but I disagree. Yum!

Fw2WtWV1HTsbZFq9bC7H6w.text: Everything was great. This place had it right. Simple menu, but excellent food. Nothing fancy, coke out of a can and lemonade in a mason jar. The tribute burger and fries were the best I had in a long time. Definitely will go back if I am ever back in London.

zfZVlojfCgqRx589WiWODw.text: Them chips though! Normally I hate fat chips because they remind me of thumbs but these were on point. The "tribute" burger is a straight up beast, I keep thinking about it and it's confusing me... sexually. Shout out to the lemonade too

VN1vblGm41Xv38RJFAqywg.text: (Insert pun about the name "honest" and the good nature of these burgers)The burgers were deliciously prepared. I could eat the red onion relish and rosemary salted fries and still be amazing satisfied. Beef burger still delicious, though!Service is exceptionally good. Wait staff is friendly (but hard to recognize as they don't wear any semblance of a uniform). But I felt welcomed and loved every moment of the meal.

jRyzew8EoqopZAfqNW-3sQ.text: Best burger I've had in London so far. Little expensive but worth trying if you're in kings cross

IOeQUYK-lI5WMXoa-emctA.text: This is one of the best places to get a burger in London. It was very crowded when my friend and I went there for lunch on a week day, so we decided to eat at the bar instead of waiting for a table. I got the beef burger with cheese, and it was very juicy and absolutely delicious. Even the fries were fantastic. Although there were only two waitresses when I was there, they were very friendly and efficient, and the food arrived fairly quickly.

0TdBsimA6e3gstf1fK91Sg.text: Great place, great burgers. Try the special Christmas Burger...awesome. Wish they would also offer a desert after the meal.

D7U65AJIOFlXCosjNg25-w.text: Great burger, one of the best I have had in London. Very comfortable environment. Would definitely recommend.

n1l3bdLFrQcLgDNYfgGAhQ.text: I think I was having a bad day there! My homemade lemonade didn't arrive as full to the brim as the other tables, my rosemary fries were more like very salty crunchy crisps than fries, and my burger was well done, rather than the medium that I was expecting. So with that I'm struggling to give any more than an A-OK, but I'll definitely keep it bookmarked for another try.

NCR20zyNvXPb3gYpZqAvbQ.text: Honestly, I am in trouble!  This place is in between my flat and my closest tube.  It is going to take all willpower not to eat there weekly.I loved everything about Honest Burger.  First of all, great attentive service.  Thank you kind waitstaff!  Great vibe and lots of seating (although I didn't check out downstairs) but I liked the layout with booths, community tables, bar seating.  It just was casual yet inviting.  OK, good burger.  Cooked pink (hallelujah!), delicious bacon, great onions, cheese--just the right flxin's on an Honest Burger to add flavor and texture without overpowering the tour de force meat.  Big fan of the rosemary salt fries as well.Oh, and did I mention the Hefeveizen beer from Portland Oregon on special that came with chilled mugs?  FANTASTIC.The menu is quite extensive--I wish I had the appetite to try all of the sides and fritters--from sausages to coleslaw to cauliflower fritters.  Next time.....I wish they offered frequent eater cards.

mlwyuUDUvuJ3EUGU08hKXQ.text: Just look at their menu. You'll already know they're a good place to eat.My party all enjoyed our various burgers + veggie burger, and the fries were pretty good too. The service was very good at first but we had to ask for our check twice -- the first person must've forgotten. I'd usually downgrade a place 1 star for that kind of mistake, but the burgers were *very* good.

PVt5_O3tYMnSaql1HOkGYQ.text: I would recommend this place just for their yummy meat. Delicious.The menu remain quite simple, no fancy recipe here except one. They focus on the classics. So, I chose the most classic, the cheeseburger. Only the Brewburger attracted my attention by the way.After the first bite: no surprise, the cheese melted on the meat make this burger so tasty. Only the fries were not so exceptional.With a coke, you get the perfect combo.The open-kitchen is located downstairs and is visible to everyone.The service is quite fast, but a bit pretentious I think.Price is reasonable. Drink and eat for £10 no more.Fast Good Food!

z64A769cDrzSdOJaxEX2Ig.text: There isn't much better in life than a damn good burger and that's what you get here. I, for one, am always at my happiest when I bite into a juicy burger to see a hot pink centre of meat staring back at me. Yes, my minimum requirement is that the burger is medium rare and Honest Burgers deliver.I'd been to the Soho branch before, which is much smaller with only around 30 seats. This one is much bigger with seats spread over two floors. They even have a bar area here *shock horror* which comes in handy with the wait times. Like the other branches, there's usually a decent chunk of wait time no matter what time of day you go. Luckily their wait list system is pretty stellar as it all goes through your phone. They text to confirm you're on the wait list and then you can watch your progress through the queue before they text to say your table's ready. So you can either hang by the swanky bar area or go explore the surroundings while your table's being readied. Back to the food now, the sides are good. Rosemary and potato is a killer combination so rosemary chips are a definite plus. And they have onion rings the size of your head so you can't really go wrongDrinks are also pretty solid. I was super impressed when my beer came to my table in a stein. A STEIN DAMMIT. SO COOL. All drinks should be served in steins from now on. tl;dr burgers are gorgeous, wait list system almost makes waiting fun, steins

2WE7UYXLAvwVbVn25vHuQg.text: Not a very varied menu so I tried the Tribute burger (sans pickles) with a Bourbon tea sour. The burger was just okay, it smelled a little odd to me, like an 'old' smell, but that could have been the overwhelming rosemary on the fries. I was not a fan of those at all. I like a bit of rosemary in bread or ground up in a spice mix, but these were quite overpowering - and there's no alternative available on the menu. The tea sour was really good, even though I was sceptical over the egg white ingredient. Overall, and I know I'm in the minority here, it was not worth the money I paid.

8mvkRsjREezPwZMUtPWjJw.text: Always has been a big fan of Honest Burger, now 9 branches strong with surely more underway, will it become the new Byron? Like most other hipster burger joints, they come up with special every once a while, and this time it was Beef, smoked bacon, Honest guacamole, Swiss cheese and Harissa mayonnaise, the spice mixture and the thick texture of the guacamole didn't really worked for me, it was a really heavy burger with a rather odd taste. However the classic Honest has been still as good as ever, well cooked medium beef patty and a great selection of garnishes. Plus the every delightful rosemary chip that is perhaps the best chips you can get at that price level.

4QVzpYk7_GMb2ZJzOHdltw.text: Yep, 2 trips to 2 different Honest Burger restaurants in the space of 3 days....It's great! Cheese Burger and Bacon Burger rocked! Am yet to try the Brew Dog burger... maybe tomoza...! Simple and tasty and good value!If it's a burger and chips you are after, defo go to Honest Burgers. It's up there with Patty and Bun for me. Both fab! Recommend!! This venue is quite large, with downstairs seating too. Good music, lively and friendly atmosphere. GO NOW!

v1IRM6MfxSCKVewOQn7W7A.text: Honest Burger is taking London by storm! While Soho and Brixton ones seem the most popular one, the real gem is this one down the road from King's Cross. You can still rock up during the weekday lunch rush and get a seat, plus you get served quickly as the service is really good.So how does an Honest Burger rank against the others like Five Guys, Shake Shack, Tommi's and others? Well, let's put it this way, none of them have The Rib Man Burger which features a tasty burger covered in The Rib Man's 'Christ on a Bike' hot sauce. Makes this burger special...and amazing! Their homemade lemonade is quite good and for £1 more, you get unlimited refills.Overall, this is a great burger joint and one definitely worth returning too. Can't wait to try the BrewBurger soon!

Vd4Rvbke-VyTM2yrKz6MDA.text: We've been to Honest Burger three times. Staff were friendly. The food tends to be served relatively quickly, and it was good the first two times we went. For some reason, last night, the burgers were really salty. I barely could finish mine, even though I was really hungry. My fiance really likes salty food, and it was too salty even for him. In addition, we were unpleasantly surprised to be charged for water (that was probably tap water?). When we were asked for our drink order, we had said, "Just water, please," and they brought an open-topped carafe and a few empty glasses. Our bill later had a charge of one pound per person for water. That seemed a bit tacky to me.

LV8tEamWD9xZ0xhbsEl5-g.text: The clue is in the name. You know what you are going to get here - a good honest burger!We took the blue cheese burger - amazing. This place is too close to work to be healthy. My only point was that there was no cutlery! We weren't sure if this was intentional or an oversight. Either way, we ploughed on!Will certainly be back.

zjM7tiT1jcAdW9jyBGZj9A.text: The fries were brilliant, best fries in London as far as I can tell. The burgers were also really tasty and the lemonade was house made and really good. The prices were fair but there is a reservation system, so get there first (We were waiting for 1,5h) reserve a table and grep a beer in an other bar until the table is ready.

VfjUMRpkvgh4Lqr1OFdTRA.text: While I was traveling with my cousin abroad in London, we happened to catch this place while walking along with decent reviews so we decided to try this place out! Boy, we were not dissapointed! They have a small menu that you can choose from a selective few signature burgers and sides and drinks. The food was delish and came out quickly! Must I say that this has probably been one of the juiciest burgers i've had in a very long time and miles away from home but they did such a great job on making it tasty. I only took a star off my review because the service is a bit slow and the workers who work there do not help you too much, you literally have to flag them down for any assistance. I'm not sure if the reason was because we weren't the native people who lived on this land or that's just how the service here really is. But the food quality was great! I'll definetly have to come back when I do make my way abroad again.

dhbbaET8KQDKGV-004uGUQ.text: The most juicy burger I have ever had! Still I think it can be more salty. The chips are good too! Quite a nice place to hang out

zLNsunDjKC-k1xPrqldw3w.text: Simple but flavoursome, I opted for the chicken burger with a side order of onion rings, rosemary salted fries comes with every burger. Service was quick, and the bacon ketchup is my absolute fave. Will be returning for another "fatso" day.

UZZ5--eMF8uUNgtnIBvKew.text: fantastic burgers! Go here often for lunch and the service and food is always great.

mHTioSQLOY8kn4XwMkDL4A.text: Fodmap friendly - people friendly (gluten free burgers!)Ok it takes a significant amount for me to be this happy with somewhere - but Honest Burgers has it for me! Why - because of the below things!1. Menu - Wheat free, burgers and bun - and as far as I'm aware an option for a garlic and onion free experience (take off the sauces). The burger cooked to order - i had a medium rare - and 100% beef i beautiful. Assuming their marketing is correct they have ethically reared meat - which makes for an additional YAY! so.. yay! Also they have particularly tasty chips - the chips are somewhere between a chip and a fry - slee photos! and the rosemary makes them such a delight. Personally I do enjoy a cheese burger so I had the honest burger with Stilton (in addition to the cheddar)2. Service: I like waiting staff to be friendly, sincere, human, light hearted and happy to help. The staff at this place (i've been twice) have been all of these things. Even when I'm unpicking the menu for my perfect order, never are they 'put out' by my awkward ordering, and they are happy to have a little 'banter'. Had a delightful chat about the lack of dessert menu with them - and they didn't seem to be humouring me, that sense they were sincerely enjoying their job.  In addition to this I must add - myself and my friend miscalculated and thought we'd paid tip - we told the staff the tip was included on the card - and they informed us (they weren't going to but we approached them about it) that we were actually short by 90p and they covered it and not to worry - seriously! I was very impressed - and also appauled that our maths were that bad - impressive, service, and they had covered our 90p shortfall themselves. (We did tip in cash in the end)in terms of atmosphere - casual burger bar - with a gastropub-esque vibe - its not mcdonalds - there is a nice bar, with a good selection - its not 'bar lighting' its a little bit lighter, its always been packed when i've been in, but a short wait for a table.One of my favs as a fodmap free diner

PVpNW35f5XVBQMmUBgW3gQ.text: I finally visited last Monday night after it was highlighted by my BurgerApp. I found it no problem and what a great place.I was greeted almost immediately by the male server, who showed me to a bar seat.The menu is simple and all you would ever need, short & sweet.I ordered the Honest Burger and a Paulaner beer, the beer arrived in short time in a frozen glass, brill!!!!.The burger arrived within 10mins and what a sight to behold, wow!The bun was soft and glazed and was just right, my first bite was absolutely superb and I savoured every bite from there on in.The burger was cooked medium rare, just to my liking and the standard cook time.The chips are also so moreish, you wish for more on the plate. Just thinking about it, I want one now, but living in Cornwall it's a bit of a trip!An must if in London

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

5VIUMkRMHlYHUUfzBiyRPA.text: Best burger I've had in London.  Love the sweetness to it.  This location near Kings Cross also has exceptional customer service.  I saw the staff say goodbye to every patron that left, it felt like everyone was a regular there.  Coming from the US, I'm not used to that from a burger joint!

zQB-PW4n4Vx9W82i9jig_g.text: Maybe my American roots make me predisposed towards messy, juicy burgers. Maybe my expectations are too high. This is going to be a very unpopular opinion. I've hesitantly stated it to friends before, but it's time to come clean: this burger is solidly average. I guess it depends how you like your burgers, but every time I eat at an Honest Burgers, I just am not wowed by their burgers. Their rosemary chips are divine and the staff is always friendly; the restaurants always cozy. I don't think I'm overly snobby about burgers, and I'd never compare an affordable-range burger to something like Hawksmoor. The problem is this: they somehow manage to make a medium rare burger without any real juice. HOW? Where is the juice and the grease? It doesn't need to be sopping and dripping, but there should be something to it. The toppings are great, especially on the special burgers. I'd gladly meet a friend here for dinner if they suggested it. But if I'm in the mood for an amazing burger? It would never be my first choice. I feel sad to say it, but also relieved to finally be out about it.

VwDIe9rUoUNYJLroxD_zdQ.text: Nothing too fancy. Withouth complications. Just a simple menu. Great Burgers! Just like that. One of the best I had in London so far. Amazing rosemary chips with every burger.No menu dessert or coffee, but it's not a problem. Just Honest Burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Burgers!

PfQvCFI5MPk4Misy4aYxeA.text: My girlfriend and I came here on our first night in the city. We just spent 5 days in Madrid so a good burger and a pint sounded fantastic. This place far exceeded our expectations. The quality of the meat was amazing, the fries were perfect, and the overall price for food and a couple of pints makes this place well worth it. Not only does this place have great food, it has an amazing service staff as well. Everyone was very friendly and outgoing. They were even very gracious when we asked some typical American touristy questions. We're only here for 3 nights and we might come back. I highly recommend coming here.

oINQoxJiqHUllCqKmjVzpw.text: I was visiting the London area and I was in charge of finding places to eat! Our final night there we didn't want anything too fancy.  We checked out this little place.  It was a Saturday night and there was not a line! The food was cooked the way we asked.  We ordered the onion rings, they had a different taste to them (we didn't like so they went to waste).  I ordered the special and he ordered the honest burger.  The ingredients for the burgers/fries were very fresh! I would definitely recommend checking this place out if you want a good burger in London!  The reason I gave this place 4 stars is because they did not give out their Wi-fi.  That was the 1st and only place while visiting London/France that would not share the Wi-fi.  I was a little upset about that but got over it. . . lol

4xV4PW1IBorg1vQ-59GiZQ.text: Honest Burgers is all the rave in London at the moment. That's why it's hard to get in without a massive wait. I didn't understand why, they were just burgers? This one is round the corner from the man's work, and after a particularly bad day, I decided I needed a burger. And check out what all the fuss is about.Atmosphere:If you're into hipster-y / retro designs - you will love this place. I was actually quite impressed by the level of detail brought into making this place seem simple  and old fashioned - right into the loos! It gives the place a fun vibe - and I like themes. Service:We did have to wait 20min to get a space, and we waited with a drink. They were friendly enough, but did have to try and gesture to the barman 5min to get his attention for a drink, and 10min extra to order our burgers. Mmpf. I mean there are 5 items on the menu, I was a bit dissapointed.Food & Drinks:We ordered an Ice Tea Sour - that was made as a sour but with bourbon and ice Tea, and served in a jar. You know, the hipster jar with a paper straw. Cute, but tasted a bit meh.In terms of food, I went for their Special - and of course fries. My other half had warned me that what was awesome about Honest Burgers wasn't so much the burger, but more the fries. And he was right. The rosemary fries with still the skin on are TO. DIE. FOR. And the burger was REALLY decent too!Price:VERY IMPRESSED. £5 for the cocktail, £11 for the Special Burger. Good deal, great food.Final impression:I juggled between a 4 and a 5 star - and when going over the price element considering the quality of the food and the effort put into the venue, and despite the small hiccups with service, I decided to give them a well deserved 5.

iPY3s5MutYCFkNVcdz6nBw.text: Honestly good burgers. There  are a whole bunch of burger joints popping up all over london over the past couple of years but this one is one of the better ones. It looks like any other decent chain with clean displays, clean floor, but the burgers are really decent. The beef is of a higher quality and the whole experience comes to you in a nice big plate with rosemary salted chips. The beef is aged and tastes just right.A good place for group dining

kOeBoiyAFYe6sSKPrvdOkw.text: The burgers are ace. But you know what's better? The fries. I will come back for those alone. They're just so crunchy and flavoursome (thanks to a sprinkle of rosemary-salt) and I simply can't imagine my life without them anymore. Is there a Rosemary-fries-addict-anonym somewhere? I think I might need help to stop my obsession.

t97PJamB9JxtU0hue0QnHA.text: In UK I have seen so many restaurants and pubs where they don't even ask for how u like your burger. Medium? Medium rare? Welldone? They just cook it the way they like and serve it and I really have some problems finding the burger that I like. After I met with Honest Burger I got a juicy burger finally. Honest Burger is the one best of the gourmet burgers in London. Service is quick and staff is friendly, the atmosphere is cosy, burgers are juicy, well-seasoned and u don't have to pay extra for chips as they serve them with burgers. #honestburger #london #londoner #foodie #burger #gourmetburger #

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

FQfKoos5-ydIQYxUBqoIbg.text: I realize that not every burger can be the best, but this might very well have been. Cooked to perfection, juicy (succulent! ) yet crisp, great sides, and truly fantastic rosemary fries. Actually, the fries for sure are the best I've ever had, crispy as actual crisps/chips on the outside and prefect texture on the inside, with a mild yet unsuspectedly mindblowing taste of rosemary. And this is a chain! Moving to any country where you can find this a.s.a.p.!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Enough said!

HjQwzdSnaOSpBxX9AUsGlg.text: Another Honest Burgers. You get what you expect: a decent burger with great rosemary chips in a cozy and relaxed atmosphere.The latest location of the quickly growing British burger restaurant micro-chain Honest Burgers is located just a short walk from King's Cross and St. Pancras International stations. And while I have not yet been to the Camden and Portobello shops, I think it is safe to say that their King's Cross restaurant is the biggest so far, it even has two levels with an open kitchen downstairs. The wooden interior gives this branch a nice atmosphere, in line with the other two Honest Burgers I know. If you have been to any other Honest Burgers branch, you will know what to expect. A delicious and solid burger with noteworthy rosemary chips that are among the best in London, I would say. When I went on the opening day, I ordered the excellent Christmas special: juicy beef patty, camembert cheese, cranberry sauce, smoked bacon and rocket. For me, this burger is probably as good as any burger could ever get, cranberry sauce and camembert is a winner combination and works very well with the beef patty and the smoked bacon. I was only a bit disappointed to see that the bun was a bit soggy and basically could not copy with all the toppings, which made this meal a bit more messy than usual at Honest Burgers - not less enjoyable though. In general, Honest Burgers have a simple menu. It is easy to read and without too many options, so you can order quickly. However, they always have some special burgers on and I was told that only the Portobello and King's Cross branches will offer the Tribute burger. So if you're into the Tribute, you now have two locations to choose. Service was friendly, and despite the waiting time before anyone even came up to me to check where they could seat me, I enjoyed my visit at this new Honest Burgers branch. They still do not offer any desserts, and I am not yet sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing. But no matter if you have a sweet tooth or not, I can only recommend Honest Burgers for what they do, because they do it well: burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Christmas special.

02coE7eh5rCMf_-JsMnCcg.text: The fries are pretty good  but the chicken burger I ordered was ok. The service was pretty cool. Our waitress was very attentive and we were seated in the lower level area where we could see the grill from our seating booth. I preferred this seating area versus the upper level . The upper seating area was drafty with the door constantly being pulled open.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Burger & Fries

-IG-F1JoJX3Ze_7QaKlTlA.text: Good juicy burgers, free rosemary salted fries alongside to top the burgers. Friendly staff and good ambience. Will definitely visit again. Good location, very close to Kings Cross. The takeaway service took a while, though the place was crowded on that day. They also have discounts for students (though I am not one).  Good variety and selection of burgers, and also local beers and wines.

Nk-6opjYEMF91kx5oYQ8aQ.text: I heard they have some tasty burgers...true.My only gripe is that they don't take bookings but we rocked up with 8 at midday and were seated easily (it did fill up over the next hour though).The menu is small but everything on it seemed to be done well, if not well done (boom boom). The burgers are on the small side but the portion of fries is generous (and tasty). My veggie friend was happy, having spent the previous hour lamenting the soggy portobello on a bun that he usually has to endure. At £10 for a burger and fries it won't be a regular lunch haunt but compared with local street food vendors it certainly couldn't be deemed pricey. Definitely a good option for a cheap dinner and worth the short walk from kings cross if you're waiting for a train. The drink options aren't run of the mill and the staff were friendly. We all left with smiles on our faces.

iHOXNm77PJvyKgcGru69Pw.text: The burger is delicious, and very nicely cooked, but what took us by surprise were the wings, which were seriously addicting!The environment had a cool, industrial vibe. A great place to meet up with your hip, tatted up, tight jean wearing friends.

xiO6wV7yYoUHCJ9ulIfpqw.text: Great burgers, bright and busy space, pretty good everything else.Full disclosure: my expectations weren't that high.  My first exposure to Honest Burgers was via takeaway at my office, and I was unimpressed - the bun was stale and the burger was cold.But at this location it was a completely different story.  The burger was the best I've had in London, the bun was fresh, the rosemary fries were tasty, and their lemonade was delicious.  At first we were stuffed in the middle two seats of a 6-seater table, which was okay, but were then able to move to a comfortable booth when a larger party arrived.  The place was quite busy, but our food arrived pretty quickly and payment was easy despite a variety of servers handling our table over the course of the meal.  Finally, I know they source their meat from Ginger Pig, where I took a butchery class and which handles their meat with great care, and it shows in the flavor of the burgers.  So if you can handle the slightly chaotic atmosphere that comes from serving a lot of food pretty quickly, I think the burgers are worth it.

OL-tDZUcYsnRwgLn1P5vag.text: DinnerAte special one with my hubby.I'll call it god's hand crafted burger - divine!It was with chorizo and chimicuri source. It was just marvelous.Rosemary smelled chips is so unique which you cannot have at others. They are my favorite now.Two issues. You wait for a while. Perhaps a proof of being so popular. This special is not served anymore (Tear)

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

klG785Z5d8Toa6TJL45Vvw.text: A newish addition I think to the Honest Burger mini chain and a good location on Pentonville road near Kings Cross. They've done a nice job on the conversion in a Victorian building on a corner site with a ground floor and basement restaurant. Inside it's simple, clean, feels good.First time trying Honest Burger so was quite excited. Ordered the standard burger without cheese, medium, as recommended by the waiter. A side dish of beetroot and apple coleslaw sounded good and at £2.50 the price is right for a side. A few minutes later the burger arrived in a nice bowl together with plenty of chips (included) along with the well sized side dish of slaw.Yum. It was just right. Everything... The burger itself was great with an onion relish topping. Served medium on a toasted bun, it had everything right. The server recommended some chipotle mayo which was pretty good. Strong smoky chipotle flavour and plenty of heat. The side of slaw was pretty good too and a decent size.Here's a key point of difference for me. This is one of the few new mini chains opening up that actually provides a decent, generous serving size, something which is notably absent from some other new places, perhaps not wanting to risk that you might actually be hungry and want to leave satisfied. I never understand that. Mean portions + high prices are a deal breaker for me, especially for simple, casual food like this.Thank you Honest burger for fulfiling that simple wish.  The rosemary chips were just great and perfectly CRUNCHY! Some of the best fries I've had.Service was great: friendly, confident, to the point and no nonsense. That's all I want.

6w_DABZiEl41a-LknFVh7w.text: Went there today around 6pm and the restaurant was almost full surprisingly. Ordered cheddar cheese burger. The beef was good, really nicely cooked, pink in the middle. However the sauce in between wasn't my type it is slightly too sweet. The onion rings and salad we ordered were okay nothing special. The burger is really simple and honest just like their name. I do like their homemade lemonade. Service wise, not really impressive. Waited quite a long time for our bill and the card machine downstairs was really slow.

Sk-2jQXOvm1sAdrAy23XhQ.text: Burgers were great, only to be outdone by the chips. Really enjoyed the food, and casual atmosphere.

B1_HQsrGZ9lUQJ_UTcZtXw.text: Delicious!!! I've been hearing good things about Honest Burgers for a long time now I thought it was about time I checked it out. I'm so glad I did! The rosemary fries are deliciously crunchy and very salty. I had the chicken burger with gluten free bun which was delicious,  huge piece of chicken and the gluten free bun was soft and didn't taste gluten free at all. My partner had the beef cheese burger which he thought was really good. We didn't order any other drinks aside from tap water and thr total bill came out to £18 which was very reasonable. The service was good too despite the restaurant being very busy. I will definitely be back. Best burgers I've found in London so far!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and beef cheese burgers with rosemary fries

b1BKt5nbDwV-emUh5a-mOQ.text: Would have loved to give 5 stars but had an issue. Great food, our waiter was very friendly. However, my friends mother was a few minutes behind us and was supposed to meet us inside. We were seated downstairs, not immediately visible from the front door. The waitress working would not allow her mother to come inside to sit down with us. Her mother explained she knew we had come in a minute earlier, and although she didn't see us, asked the waitress if we were seated downstairs and if she could look. The waitress rudely told her no one was downstairs (we WERE downstairs) and did not allow her to come inside any further. My friends mother walked back to the hotel alone, without her coat (we had it with us). Meanwhile my friend and I started wondering where she was and even went outside to look for her. We only found out what happened when we got back to the hotel and found her. She was very upset and shaken up with the way she was spoken to. Like I said, great food. Would love to come back but unfortunately will not after being treated this way. Teach the offending member of the staff not to be so rude because otherwise it was a great place to eat.

x76jQxFVZS_xuqKirry_ZQ.text: My boyfriend Ross had raved about Honest Burgers as he previously had one of their special burgers, onion rings and chicken wings while he was in town for the London Coffee Festival and was adamant that I should try it.Even though they have Honest Burgers Locations dotted all over London, trusty Google Maps ensured us that it was only a stone's throw away from Kings Cross. My tired sore feet were rejoicing. Being a Bank Holiday, we weren't quiet sure if they'd be open but luckily they were and were able to get a table without any difficultly. A rare occurrence in London for the most part.The menu is petite, pretty much like the restaurant, but the food sure does pack a punch. I opted for the Tribute Burger (£10) after playing a game of eenie meenie miney mo. My burger was topped with bacon (naturally, you can never have too much bacon, as long as it's crispy!), American cheese, burger sauce, French's mustard, onions, pickles and lettuce. Ross decided to try the namesake Honest Burger (£10) which was topped with red onion relish, smoked bacon, mature cheddar, picked cucumber and lettuce. Our waitress asked if we'd like our burgers medium, definitely. It's the best way to enjoy a burger in my opinion.What I love about Honest Burgers (other than the great ingredients they use) is that all burgers come with fries. Not just any fries though, skin-on rosemary fries. It's a nuisance at times having to order separate fries, or should I say actually remember to. As we were starving and my boyfriend is a human dustbin, we also got BBQ Chicken Wings and Onion Rings on the side.We didn't have to wait long before our food was in front of us. First impressions? It looked rather inviting with the cheese oozing down the sides. Oh boy. I'm currently salivating. Upon first bite, the burger was full of flavour. You could taste the fresh ingredients and as I was battling to not let the cheese drip onto my white t-shirt, I proclaimed that this was the best burger I had ever tasted. High praise indeed. I may have had my mouth full of juicy burger goodness at said time as well. The beef did all the talking, the combination of toppings were icing on the burger cake. It was divine. A joy to eat. A little pet peeve of mine is when burger restaurants ask how you'd like your burger cooked and what you get in front of you is not what you asked for. If they state that their burgers come medium or even recommend it themselves, ensure it is medium and not well done. Luckily, Honest Burgers get it right. It was perfectly pink.Mid burger munch, I tried the skin-on rosemary fries. Perfectly seasoned, these fries were crisped to perfection. Marvellous. Not too crispy, not too limp. I loved the addition of rosemary which was different to the norm you'd get at other burger outlets. I couldn't get enough of them. Cheesy thumbs up from me!Sadly, I was a little let down with the rings and wings, which I hate to admit. As I bit into an onion ring, it was rather watery which in turn made them slightly flavourless. The BBQ Chicken Wings on the other hand were nice but a little underwhelming compared to the burgers. I adore chicken wings, but I just can't pinpoint exactly what was wrong with them, maybe the tangy sweet BBQ sauce?My boyfriend who has ordered both of these sides in the past even admitted himself that they were "different" this time. Both were edible but not as rememberable as the burger. It's hard to fault a place when the staff are so friendly, attentive & always had a smile of their faces. I loved the décor and the chilled out relaxed vibe. Prices weren't as expensive as I thought they were going to be and unlike some places I've eaten in, there was no rush to get you out the door as soon as you had finished your food. The food, for the most part, was superb hence the high overall score and I would honest-ly (heh!) go back in a heartbeat.Now if only they'd open in Glasgow.... until then, see you soon Honest Burgers

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

jmDAImj89AXkjX0VV1MbeQ.text: No list of best burger joints in London is complete without Honest Burger.It's super busy during dinner so try to book a table if you can. The venue is split across two floors, but it's much cosier downstairs. Staff are friendly and the food is very nice. In a Byron type of way it's simple and classic.The rosemary fries as everyone say are a must. The rest of the menu is simple, burgers are a choice between chicken or beef. Okay 3 options. There's a veggie burger too that at the very least looks tastier on the page than many other veggie burgers look in cooked form. So there's that going for it.There's a special brunch menu with a few more items on it. I've not had anything from it, but think of things like steak, fry ups and granola.

DL2VJWb7QJbrD6VjPdaVoA.text: Yum! Highly recommended. A short 3 minute walk from Kings Cross Station and Platform 9 3/4. The special of the day-beef burger, double smoked bacon, smoked cheddar, sauerkraut, sauce, seasoned fries, and a choice of a 1L of lager or darker Oktoberfest beer. Simply yummy-highly recommended. The burger surprisingly good-it was honestly a great burger! The fries are moderately seasoned which I enjoy, although my purist kids likely would say they are too salty. The service was also splendid. The clientele and staff is largely youthful. Im glad other reviewers also recommended it as I otherwise wouldn't have known about this gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Special burger of the day with Oktoberfest beer. Yum!

c0K6mqrHxA035ihk1m8ieg.text: I've ordered from Honest Burgers via deliveroo and eaten in two of their branches on numerous occasions.The restaurants are clean, informal places with speedy service, real fast foods that offer quality fare at an honest price, as the name suggests. My partner usually goes for the cheeseburger, whilst I only have one option as a veggie: the fritter. For £7.50 I can't really complain, a filling meal that comes with hand-cut chips, though I would loveee it if Honest Burgers came up with a few more adventurous vegetarian options! Sometimes I don't feel like so much fried food...I will continue to eat here when I feel like something that is probably not all that healthy, which doesn't happen that often fortunately.

20pGt4vib1M4YQOafX0fzA.text: Really great burgers and the staff is fantastic. Stopped in on my way home to my hotel and had a really nice experience. Worth a stop if you're in the area.

Hcw9i3F3flyCcM2eOYeJLg.text: Highly recommend the fritter burger. The combination of vegetables on the fritter is unlike anything I've had. Love that sauce too. The whole thing is delicious! And the rosemary chips are addicting. Get ready to be stuffed by the end of your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Fritter with rosemary chips. Sooo good!

CnOYWXVrEIfaOgMYW2pFAA.text: Honest has really got too big for its own good.  My last burger was... not terrible but not great. The bun was cold, the cheese wasn't melted properly and bacon wasn't crispy (too thick to crisp up). For a tribute to bacon, it certainly wasn't bacony.Chips were still good though.

m9ns_dJ1hll9qb_Y12I_IA.text: I was so hungry. My brothers an I decided to roam the streets in search for food. It was our last dinner in London and we find Honest Burger. This place looked amazing. We walked in and we were seated by a lovely lady. Someone then took our drink orders, then food, you know the usual. I ordered the Honest Burger (check out my picture to see what's on it). The burger was fantastic. Cooked to perfection with bacon, lettuce, and pickles. I loved every bite of it, and the chips were just the icing on the cake. I also got a side of onion rings and they were delicious as well. They were crispy and warm while the inside had a nicely cooked onion.This place was honestly one of the best food places I at in during my stay in London. Maybe it's because I'm American, but you can't get it like this in America. Craving a burger? Go to Honest Burger. It will HONESTLY be the best burger you've ever tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The establishment.
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Drink side of the menu.
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Front of the menu. It's very simplistic, I love it!

sp25K53JG9WuTn4eZ3DURg.text: Honest Burger is conveniently situated  a few minutes walk from Kings Cross Underground station.  It's a decent sized venue on one level although the toilets are downstairs.  The main service station is to the left as you walk in and there's lots of seating.I've enjoyed meals at other Honest Burger branches and nipped into this branch for a quick bite.  I was able to order a standard burger and fries with a soft drink but unfortunately wasn't able to eat it as I was taken ill, nothing to do with Honest Burger though.  My friend ordered the same meal, loved it and said it was just as good as other branches she's been to.  The staff here were great, friendly and went out of there way to help.  Most of all the manager Simon once alerted to the fact that I felt sick came over to ask how I was and how he could help.  He was super helpful and even gave me tissues and brown paper bag in case I was sick on the way home.  I'm very impressed at the way they look after their staff and definitely will be back to this branch.

pFKxDXYhE8J-9LV1ivw4Jg.text: Ah man, I just love honest! The fries are just something else! Crispy and in some sort of deliciously addictive rosemary salt. The best part is they come complimentary alongside the burger! It likes they know you need them! Burger wise, I'm pretty predictable when I go to honest, I always get the chicken burger without fail and damn do they do a good one. The chicken is never dry and grilled to perfection! Honestly can't fault the food. The only annoying part is at busy time, you might have to share a table with other people, if there's only two of you. But, don't let that put you off, the food is seriously delicious!

m3lYfn9rt6J0n2zM6Iwx1A.text: Went here multiple times that's how much us Americans love this place, specifically this location! The atmosphere and the people here are awesome! On top of the awesome people, the food is amazing!! Must stop here if you are visiting the U.K.! Can't wait to come back to the U.K. just to come back here!

k_o3LUpySxac81NnGpjBwQ.text: Coming from America, I consider myself to be a relative expert on a good burger. SO, seeing that this place was so close to where I am staying, I decided "why not?"The restaurant itself had a nice vibe to it. Good atmosphere and the service seemed to be very prompt and courteous as well.I had one of their special burgers, as I saw that it was spicy and I always like a little bit of kick!Honestly, it was very good. The chips (fries, whatever) that came with it were well seasoned and crispy. The burger itself had good flavor, better than a lot I've had in the states!The only knock is that it cost me about 11 pounds, or about 17 dollars. A little on the expensive side for a gourmet burger (a la Red Robin), but otherwise I would maybe come here again on a monthly basis to see the changes in their specials!

UEyc7_JQGbxGWsutwB55Hw.text: Oh Honest Burger, you are honestly my favourite place to get a burger in London. I usually order the simple beef burger (sometimes with cheese). It might just be me but I feel like their burgers are on the smaller side. This may be due to the fact that I am always starving when I eat here so I plough through the burger. But said burger is absolutely delicious and the portion of chips definitely makes up for my perception anyway. I'm also a fan of including the chips with the burger instead of being a separate side you have to order. I always leave this place full and happy. Plus the lemonade is the best. Proper American style homemade lemonade yum!I've only ever been here at lunch when there are plenty of tables available but they have an awesome basement seating area with lots of cool booths. This is my favourite location because 1) it's kind of close to UCL and of course Kings Cross and 2) on sunny summer days the sunlight just streams through all the windows making the most pleasant, joyful atmosphere anyone could hope for. Especially if you get to sit in a booth by the window. Try to snag that seating next time, not only can you people watch (or car/bus watch because wow is that street busy) but I promise you the lighting also makes for great photos!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. beef burger + cheese
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Lemonade!

22632pSNZTeLB_JTCd2-CA.text: People keep raving so despite not loving it, I keep coming... But I'm seriously not going to bother anymore. The lemonade is lovely and refreshing, the coleslaw is really nice, the chips... Well I guess if you love chips with rosemary then they're pretty good, but the burgers... The actual burgers... I left half of mine because it literally made my tastebuds bored- yes BORED. There is nothing special about these burgers... Even the one I had last night which was called "The Special"... Nothing that makes this burger stand out, no complimenting tastes or textures, just felt like a block of chewy overly salty rubber in my mouth. I love burgers, but this is simply NOT on my must-eat list.

CcQYAWJJBuCNbwqY7n_5yA.text: Restaurant good for coeliacs with its option of wheat-free buns and burgers on request. By the way, these burgers are delicious!You should also try home-made lemonade with fresh mint, very tasty!

xyJpf3hA--hDSVq6W8jLhg.text: I have a confession to make, I am a burger fanatic! I love my burgers and would try as many popular burgers as possible.This place reminds me of Bareburger in New York where they have an established brand name in the city with their signature gourmet burger. The buns were soft and the meat was juicy. The rosemary fries were done to perfection- flavorfully crunchy. I got the honest burger with bacon and was afraid it was too much protein. It wasn't. The portion was substantial but everyone at my table finished their burgers and fries with a smile.Order their limeade or lemonade if you want an nonalcoholic drink to pair well with your burger. Unlike your standard lemonade, it's only slightly sweetened, which surprisingly goes well with your fries and burgers.Service was standard, maybe slower than normal but hey you're here for your burger so patience will do you well!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Honest burger with the famous rosemary fries that was done to perfection. Housemade limeade on the side.

Ub9zwk3JKlQJJdoFCguw2A.text: Fellow Elite Yelper Andrew M organised a little dinner here to try the Brewburger, Honest Burger's collaboration this month with BrewDog.this location is bigger than their Soho or Brixton locations and definitely feels more spacious. The staff manage the queues well and our table of 5 was seated swiftly.We shared a selection of starters, the best of which was a trio of battered sausages. I also liked the spicy chipotle mayo, which was a good foil for the generous bowl of crispy fries, which came with the burgersWe all went with the Brewburger, consisting of a beef patty topped with beer candied bacon and beer BBQ sauce in a brioche bun. It was nice but I was relieved that the beer flavour didn't really come through as I'm teetotal. The beef patty could possibly have done with a little more seasoning tooThe lack of a dessert menu meant that we left in search of dessert. However, this is one of the better burgers chains in London town

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Brewburger
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Battered sausages
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

MFKF6bIuxWLF6732Y33hSA.text: This location was a few blocks from where I was staying. Everything was closed for bank holiday. I'm so not used to that. Holidays in the states you can still eat, you can still have fun, you can still see any form of living. So when I came back to the area I ordered takeout. The guy with the mustache, who I'll just call Mr. Mustache, was cute. I ordered with him. I wanted a lemonade to go but they didn't have to go cups. I waited quite a while actually. Almost 20 minutes for a burger and chips. I took my food back to my room and the chips were hard and unappealing. The burger was good but the bun didn't hold up. It was quite soggy and depressing. The staff was cool but that food for 10 pounds needs improvement. Or maybe I need to dine in. I'll go with the latter and just try them at another point.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Fries are extremely overdone.

9IngUtJBba42L6DUB7D6Zg.text: Honestly, best burgers ever tried. Perfectly cooked medium rare patty the meat. There are so many in the burger that I can't remember but make a perfect combination that I feel like party in my mouth! Go for the saucy tribute guys...

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

5mgvwqYsRiyj8FBL8gn_5w.text: Pretty place for a fast burger and some fries - and for London - its quite affordable, too! Liked the burgers but also had a salad and some lemonade. The whole food was great and I enjoyed it twice in a couple of days ;-)

MRE5iJQptjoXfTX6eBz6wA.text: This was by far one of the best burger places to be blown over by.  We just flew into London and discovered this delightful restaurant just around the corner of our AirBnB.  We were first meet by Daniel who assured that our party of 5 would be seated soon and a short later the line outside was just us and we were warmly welcomed by Tom who gave us the rundown of the menu and made us feel like part of his family.  Cassandra was very attentive to our needs as was Tom.  Michael pitched in and attended to our needs before we could ask. By far the best experience ever in a place we've only heard about and they measured up to be as legendary and scrumptious as we have heard.  If you ever visit London you must visit Honest Burgers as the food and service is truly worth the effort to visit.  You will not be disappointed as Tom, Daniel, Michale and Cassandra made the experience memorable.

WnaJZHtWZ6pNbWCpmSI4XQ.text: The advantage with restaurant chains is that you can always expect the same quality ...Usually ... but apparently not always at "Honest Burger". During the last eight months I have been to this chain more than once, in detail two times in this branch. Which concludes that I really like the food in general. The service has always been very friendly in other restaurants of this chain.Unfortunately, they failed here both times!When I came in today I found it rather disappointing that they refused me to choose a seat, although 90% of the seats were neither occupied nor visibly reserved. I would have liked to sit by the window, but this was rejected by the staff.The burger was very soggy and the fries did not taste at all because they were way too dark and charred. Apart from that no one appeared to ask if everything is alright. So I had to go to the counter to ask for the missing fork.When paying by card at the end (without my approval to use it "contactless") I was asked to enter the tip amount (while the lady was watching what I did). In the restaurant were 5 guests and 7-8 people staff at this time.On both visits, the restaurant was remarkably empty, which is rather untypical for "Honest Burger". Maybe I am not the only one who has faced similar experiences.Admittedly it must be stressed, however, that the decor of the shop is very nice. therefore I give two stars in this case instead of only one.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Chili Burger
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

fQzf8Q1pUIcuw6AGP9I8Hg.text: Got a recommendation for this place from a friend so figured I'd check it out. For a burger shop who's whole thing is to not skimp on the beef patty they sure skimped on the pork belly that was supposed to be on my burger. The patties are thick here, but the rest of the topping are diminished.Also, my burger was served room temp, like it had been sitting around for 30 minutes before it was served -__-The rosemary chips are quite good and the best thing of this visit is my discovery of Karma Kola. So good and superior to Coke.Now I type this as I'm waiting 15+ min for my bill. About to ask for the 3rd time....I'm sticking to 5 Guys when I'm craving burgers next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. At least they didn't overcook it
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Skimping on the pork belly
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Smoking Locus burger

4dVkVQIXORK2hyyC7Lyoug.text: If the rating was based on food alone, this rating would be four stars. I ordered the special, which had an onion ring, bacon, and cheese. The meat was juicy and flavorful, and the flavors all worked together perfectly. The rosemary fries- to DIE FOR!! My husband ordered the honest burger, and he enjoyed every bite. We ordered a ginger ale and lemonade, and we were surprised that the lemonade was carbonated. It was fine, but not described on the menu. Food is definitely worth coming back for. If the rating was on service alone, that would be 0 stars. When we entered, we were treated by a friendly worker who seated us. Menus were handed to us immediately. That was awesome. But then we waited....and waited.....and waited. My husband even went up to the bar and asked if we order at the bar or at our table, even though we watched other tables order from a server. After 30 minutes (no exaggeration- I was watching the clock on the wall) a server came, a blond woman. We gave her our order, and then proceeded to wait again. After 20 minutes, she brought us our drinks, apologizing for the wait in getting the drinks. So after waiting 50 minutes, we finally got our drinks. Our food was brought out shortly after, not even by our server, and we happily ate. When we finished, another server cleared our plates away. We never saw our server come to us again. She would go downstairs and disappear for quite some time. We waited for our check, but it wasn't brought to us. Watching other tables, we saw those servers get their checks from their servers. But we did not. After another 30 minutes (again, not an exaggeration because I was watching the clock), my husband went up to the bar and asked if we could pay. What should have been a much quicker dining experience turned into almost 2 hours. Completely ridiculous. So, if we lived in London, we would not return to this place. There are plenty of other places to get a good burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The special burger with rosemary fries. Delicious!

cIaO4Q116SuDZnI3oxua7Q.text: Burgers were great as always - full of flavour, relatively cheap too. We ordered onion rings which were amazing! Mint lemonades are to die for. Restaurant is in a great location, right in the middle of Camden Market. However, not enough seats for such a busy area - we had to sit outside due to how packed it was inside. After sitting for 15 minutes, no one had drawn any attention to us so we had to ask for the menu and then had to wait a further 15 minutes to get served. Would come back here again if the service was better and more seats were added.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

1HjI_zfMK3FMuqLb23zdNg.text: Coming from California, we have tons of good burgers like Habit, In'n'Out, and Hook Burger, so when wandering the streets of London late at night and a burger craving struck, we were lucky enough to run into Honest Burgers.We came in around 30 minutes before they closed, but their staff was fantastic about not making us feel rushed, allowing us to sample a few different beers, and giving us a variety of sauces to try with our fries when we couldn't make up our mind. Oh, and the burger was fantastic. We discovered this too late but they do offer a gluten-free bread as well!

PzN8srono-gdXZWwBVc5CA.text: First time trying Honest burgers. We used Yelp reviews and boy were they right.  A burger is not just a burger after you try an Honest Burger. Mike was our waiter and he took care of us fast and explained everything on the menu.  Very reasonably priced and just a wonderful meal. Keep up the good work guys!

U6bL16DMC9UrCECjhx_hGA.text: Wonderful  hospitality - they could not of been more accommodating and sweet.  Not to mention the wine and  burger was amazing. Good quality ingredients and again just super nice people working there. Very cute and simple ambiance.

MH9rn4lqMOWfes57XSAIaQ.text: This is a place that we might have not gone too but in the end, I'm more than happy that we went. It's in a very local area and their customer service is amazing!! As soon as we went in they came to us and brought us to our table. We ordered and there was about a 7 or 8 minute wait until we got our food. We especially loved the honest beef burger and the BBQ chicken wings were phenomenal!

6C1cuMSaOyJveT4T5whA4A.text: Food was delicious. Server was warm and helpful. This place is refreshingly inviting.

lYdIdmj-cdy-yX5-4EXnLA.text: Without question the best burger place to eat in all of England. That's right, England!!! Me, my wife, and four friends received the best service start to finish. The atmosphere is the coolest, the staff is the nicest, and the food is the tastiest. The beyond burger was an amazing Choice for my vegan friend. I can't rave about this place enough. Seriously a great restaurant and I can't rave about it enough. 5 stars forever!!!

f_1SP6ntj7NkPtSvgUCEyA.text: We decided to check out Honest Burgers on a whim before a show in Camden one night, and I'm so happy we did. The menu is really small but well-crafted, and they have frequently changing specials to add a bit of fun.Portion sizes are a little bigger than your standard euro meal, and I was definitely full after my dinner. I ordered the Honest Burger with a side of chipotle mayo, and my dinner came with a plate of rosemary salted chips. Our server was incredible - friendly and attentive. We arrived at just the right time so it wasn't busy, but I can definitely see this place filling up quickly. There are a few shared tables and plenty of bar space though, so a wait wouldn't be too bad. I will admit, it's a bit pricey for a burger (two burgers and a beer for the boyf came in at £30) but honestly, it was well worth it for the great experience...and the rosemary fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Top: burger special. Bottom: honest(ly the best burger I've ever tasted) burger with a side of chipotle mayo.

0soMIXaeXa3PptVgngFtNA.text: I love a good burger.Every time I've been to Honest Burgers, I've had a good one - they are consistently great in quality and flavour. I tend to go for the Honest Burger (beef, red onion relish, smoked bacon, cheddar, pickles and lettuce) with a gluten-free bun, and I haven't been disappointed yet. Their specials are often exciting, too, but I'm not a fussy person when it comes to a burger - I like them pretty simple.The fries are crispy, and deliciously light, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

yomgSWkrNmkqr_sMjZxXpg.text: A bit on the pricey side but these burgers are really good. I had the veggie burger and was not disappointed - suuuuuper tasty. Also those rosemary fries? Outstanding. Good food, friendly service, good beer and cider - solid place.

oM56rf8g2ghDXs5F9S9-cw.text: Honest burgers is a good burger chain. We were around king's cross station looking for a good place for burgers or fish'n'chips, so we decided to go there.They have 10-12 quid burgers, that is ok because the quality is quite good overall. So, if you're craving for fast food, near the place and the waiting is not too long, it worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

7GSuqtAOzqRti4WyLNLkkg.text: Simple menu mean they can do what they do well and I always go for the Honest burger medium rare and they make it just as I like it! The rosemary fries hit the spot just right and you don't have to worry about what sides you want as it's all there for you. The lemonade is a good choice if you want something non alcoholic but I tried the Botanic gardens and it didn't fail to hit the spot! Good venue located just around the corner from Kings Cross station so if you're feeling peckish or looking for a good hearty burger I totally recommend! Reasonably priced great for friendly catch up over some good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Honest burger
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Botanic garden
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Simple does it!

2BZ1D9Ahd6qEPeACi8rksw.text: Right on for their gourmet Honest Burgers!  It is served with their very crisp and crunchy chips, so it will be an amazing combo meal!For 10 British pounds, which is more or less 20 dollars for a burger with chips, it better hit the spot!  It did. They have other sides and varieties of burgers, but my eyes were on their classic.  Keep it original and keep it simple.Servers were nice and at this Honest Burger location, they have a downstairs as well for dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Classic Signature Honest Burger with Chips

7DAlKs_nliJG5_kZw4Ueqw.text: I really liked this place! I've had varying burger joint experiences since visiting London, but this one gets high marks from me. We weren't sure if we'd get in at a peak time, but we were seated downstairs immediately and had prompt, friendly service. We both ordered cheeseburgers, with a side of fries to share and  from the time we sat down until we paid our bill, it was probably 30-35 minutes. Pretty speedy! Granted, we ate like our lives depended on it because we were trying to make a comedy gig across the way at Invisible Dot, but regardless, the food was fast, hot and delicious. The buns were fresh and brioche-y, the burgers juicy and flavorful. Mine was a bit on the rare side for my taste, but that can be a matter of preference and I finished it without a second thought.I'd definitely recommend popping in here!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

U9SvqtsHdUw5fhxdH3_YPQ.text: It's a good restaurant. It's not best hamburger in the world, but I live in the us so... for me it's a good deal. You won't regret.

_TtIAh9fJyw1RBrPiMFGEw.text: really good burger here. great service from the staff. and some decent beer on tap...went twice. excellent.
